_header: Saint Jerome was swithe good clerk and wise through all thing
Subjects: saints’ lives; Jerome, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Jerome in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Ierom was swiþe good clerc & wis In alle
                    þingeMuch he made of godes seruice þat men in chirch doþ
                    singe…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…þer Inne him burede is monekes þis was is lyues
                    endeNou god ous bringe to þilke ioie þat is soule gan to
                    wemde

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Ierome was swiþe god clerk and wis þorwh alle
                    þingeMuche he made of Godus seruise þat men doþ in chirche
                    singe…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þer Inne him buriede his Monkes þis was his lyues
                    endeNow God us bringe to þulke Ioye þat his soule gon to wende.
                    Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Gerom was swiþe gret clerk & was þorw al
                    þingMiche he made of godes seruise þat men in chirch
                    sing…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…þer in him beried his monkes þat was his liues
                    endeGod vs bringe to þilk Ioye þat his soule gan to
                    wende
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayn Jerom a doctor was a wyse man of all thyngMecull he made of
                    goddis seruyce þat now men in kyrk syngWhen thoedose þe emperour
                    was lord of grete myghtHe saw þe office of holy kyrk was noght of eynd
                    ryght…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…ffoure skore ȝere & eght of age god hym lendeGod
                    bryng vs to þat mecull blys þat hiis saule gan to wende

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Sein Ieromin was swaþe god clerk & wis þoru alle
                    þingeMuche he made of godes seruise þat me deþ in churche
                    singe…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Þer Inne him burede þis monkes þat was is liues
                    endeNou god us brynge to þulke ioie þat is soule gan to
                    wende
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 2.428-34.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Ierom was a goed clerk and wys þorw alle þingeMuche
                    he made of godes seruise þat me doþ in chirche
                    singe…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þer ynne he was yburyed at his lyues endeNow god to
                    þulke ioye vs bringe þat his soule to wende

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint Jerome was wel goud clerke & wys þorwe al
                    þyngMuche he made of godes seruise þat me doþ rede &
                    synge…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…þer in was þe goud man ybured þis was his lyues
                    endeNow god ȝyue ous parte of þe Ioie þat his saule gan to
                    wende

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Seynte Ierome was a full good clerke & wyse þorow all
                    þyngeMoche he made of goddes seruyce þat men in cherche done
                    synge…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Ther Inne hym byryedde hys monkes þis was his lyues
                    endeNowe god vs brynge to þat Ioye þat his sowle dede in
                    wend
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Ends ‘Amen’ at end of last line and ‘Explicit’
                    in lower margin, by scribe, f. 137.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Ierome (in upper margin, f. 135v, and as RT on 136v);
                    Four poemes of St Jerom and St Eustace (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of
                    contents, encompassing 4592 as
                    well)

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEin Ierom was suiþe god clerc & wis þorou al þingeMoche he made of godes seruise þat me doþ in cherche singe…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þer Inne him bureVe his monkis þis was his liues endenou god ous bringe to þilke ioie þat his soule gan to wende
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum lxiii” added to right margin by later hand (f. 137).

BLEge1993.First Lines: SEint Ierome was gret clerk & wis þorw alle þingeMuche he made of godes seruise þat me deþ ȝet singe…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Þer inne beo him burieden þat was is liues endeGod vs bringe to þat ioie þat is soule gan to wende

BLEge2891.First Lines: SEin Ierome was swuþe gud clerk and wis þoru alle þingeMuche he made of godes seruise þat me in churche deþ synge…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …þer Inne him burede is monkes þat hi him þer broȝteNou god us bringe to þulke ioie þat is soule gan to wende

BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Þerinne him burede his monekes þat was his lyues endeNou god ous bringe to þulke ioye þat his soule gan wende

BLSto949.First Lines: Seynt Ierom was a gode clerk & wys þoru alle þyngeMuche he made of godes seruyse þat me doþ in churche synge…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …þerinne yburede is monkes þis was is lyres endsNou god vs brynge to þilke ioye þat his soule gan to wende

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Ierome was wel gode clerk & wys þurȝ all
                    þingeMiche he made of goddes seruise þat men dos in chirche
                    singe…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Þer yne þis gode mon was buried þis was his lyves
                    endeNow god ȝeve vs part of þe ioye þat his soule con to
                    wende Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Ierom was a good clerke and wis in alle þingeMoche he
                    made of goddis seruise þat men in church doþ singe…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Þer Inne hym buried his monkes þis was his lyues
                    endeGod bring vs to þat Ioie to which his saule did wende.
                    Amen.
